findings.title: Missing payable modifier on Ether-receiving functions
findings.explanation: The functions lendGovernmentMoney and the fallback function accept msg.value but are not marked payable. Any attempt to send Ether to these functions will revert, effectively preventing the contract from receiving funds and disabling its core functionality.
findings.fix_suggestion: Add the payable modifier to both lendGovernmentMoney and the fallback function to allow the contract to accept Ether.

findings.title: Unchecked return values from .send calls
findings.explanation: Multiple low-level .send calls are used without checking their return values. Failed sends will be ignored, leading to potential loss of funds or inconsistent contract state.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use transfer (which throws on failure) or check the boolean return value of .send and revert on failure to ensure funds are correctly forwarded.

findings.title: Integer overflow/underflow in interest and balance calculations
findings.explanation: Calculations like amount * 110 / 100, amount * 5 / 100, buddies[msg.sender] += amount * 110 / 100, and profitFromCrash += amount * 5 / 100 are not protected against overflow or underflow, allowing a malicious sender to wrap values and manipulate balances.
findings.fix_suggestion: Integrate a SafeMath library and apply checked addition and multiplication for all arithmetic operations.

findings.title: Out-of-bounds array access on creditorAddresses
findings.explanation: The code accesses creditorAddresses[creditorAddresses.length - 1] without verifying that the array is non-empty. If there are no creditors, this will revert and block the entire function execution.
findings.fix_suggestion: Check that creditorAddresses.length > 0 before accessing elements, or handle the empty-array case separately.

findings.title: Unbounded loops in totalDebt and totalPayedOut
findings.explanation: Both totalDebt and totalPayedOut iterate over dynamic arrays without bounds on iteration count. As the arrays grow, these functions may run out of gas and become unusable, leading to a denial-of-service when trying to query totals.
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid unbounded loops by maintaining running totals in state variables or by paginate queries to limit gas usage per call.
